          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Undergraduate Program</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-12" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h2>Introduction</h2>
<p>Modern Culture and Media (MCM) is an interdisciplinary concentration&nbsp;that explores the ties between media and broader cultural and social&nbsp;formations. We stress creative thinking and critical production:&nbsp;comparative analysis and theoretical reflection, as well as work that&nbsp;integrates practice and theory. We thus bring together aspects of&nbsp;modern culture that are normally separated by university departmental&nbsp;structures such as film and media studies, fine art, literature,&nbsp;literary arts and philosophy. This concentration offers the student a&nbsp;wide range of possible specializations. &nbsp;A student might decide to&nbsp;focus on the critical study and production of a certain type or&nbsp;combination of media (print, photography, sound recording, cinema,&nbsp;video, television, and digital media); or they might focus on certain&nbsp;cultural, theoretical and/or social formations (for example, gender/sexuality in post-Cold war television, postcolonial theory and film,&nbsp;the changing form of the novel, theories of subjectivity and ideology,&nbsp;video games and theories of representation). &nbsp;These paths are united by a committement to critical thinking/practice: rather&nbsp;than reproducing conventions, MCM concentrators learn how conventions&nbsp;emerge, what work they do, and explore ways to change them.</p>
<h2><span>College Writing Requirement</span></h2>
<p>MCM concentrators <em>must </em>complete the College Writing Requirement by taking two writing-intenstive or WRIT courses.&nbsp;</p>
<p><span>For more information on this university requirement, please go&nbsp;</span><span>to: &nbsp;<a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/degree/curriculum/writing-requirement">https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/degree/curriculum/writing-requirement</a></span></p>
<h2><span style="color:#2f2a20">Concentration in MCM</span></h2>
<p>MCM supports two main undergraduate concentrations, <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/undergraduate/mcm-track-i">Track I</a> and <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/undergraduate/mcm-track-ii">Track II</a>.</p>
<p>Track I consists of 11 MCM courses. Courses from other departments may count toward the fulfillment of a focus area, and must be approved by an MCM concentration advisor as part of a coherent program of study.</p>
<p>Track II concentration consists of 11 courses distributed as follows: two core courses, two additional courses below the 1000-level, three 1000-level courses, four production courses, and one senior seminar. Students are expected to meet regularly with their concentration advisors; they are required to meet at the beginning of their seventh semester to review their concentrations.<span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<h2><span>Double Concentrations &nbsp;</span></h2>
<p><span>Students who declare a double concentration may count up to two courses for concentration credit in MCM that are also counted towards concentration credit in another department or program.</span></p>
<h2><span style="color:#2f2a20">Undergraduate Advisor 2017-2018</span></h2>
<p>Anthony Cokes<br /><a href="mailto:Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu">Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu</a></p>
<p><strong>Please Note:&nbsp;</strong>Students who have already declared a concentration using the paper form must revise that concentration and add additional concentrations by using the paper form.&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/uploads/concentrationform.pdf" target="_blank">Paper Concentration forms&nbsp;</a></p>
<p>If you have not already declared a concentration using this form, please use the <a href="https://apps.college.brown.edu/ask/">online declaration form</a>.</p>
<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-files"><legend>Related Files</legend><div class="field field-type-filefield field-field-related-files">
    <div class="field-items">
            <div class="field-item odd">
                    <div class="filefield-file"><img class="filefield-icon field-icon-application-pdf"  alt="application/pdf icon" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/all/modules/filefield/icons/application-pdf.png" /><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/uploads/concentrationform.pdf" type="application/pdf; length=809553" title="concentrationform.pdf">Concentration Form</a></div>        </div>
        </div>
</div>
</fieldset>
  </div>

	</div>

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Undergraduate Program</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-12" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h2>Introduction</h2>
<p>Modern Culture and Media (MCM) is an interdisciplinary concentration&nbsp;that explores the ties between media and broader cultural and social&nbsp;formations. We stress creative thinking and critical production:&nbsp;comparative analysis and theoretical reflection, as well as work that&nbsp;integrates practice and theory. We thus bring together aspects of&nbsp;modern culture that are normally separated by university departmental&nbsp;structures such as film and media studies, fine art, literature,&nbsp;literary arts and philosophy. This concentration offers the student a&nbsp;wide range of possible specializations. &nbsp;A student might decide to&nbsp;focus on the critical study and production of a certain type or&nbsp;combination of media (print, photography, sound recording, cinema,&nbsp;video, television, and digital media); or they might focus on certain&nbsp;cultural, theoretical and/or social formations (for example, gender/sexuality in post-Cold war television, postcolonial theory and film,&nbsp;the changing form of the novel, theories of subjectivity and ideology,&nbsp;video games and theories of representation). &nbsp;These paths are united by a committement to critical thinking/practice: rather&nbsp;than reproducing conventions, MCM concentrators learn how conventions&nbsp;emerge, what work they do, and explore ways to change them.</p>
<h2><span>College Writing Requirement</span></h2>
<p>MCM concentrators <em>must </em>complete the College Writing Requirement by taking two writing-intenstive or WRIT courses.&nbsp;</p>
<p><span>For more information on this university requirement, please go&nbsp;</span><span>to: &nbsp;<a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/degree/curriculum/writing-requirement">https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/degree/curriculum/writing-requirement</a></span></p>
<h2><span style="color:#2f2a20">Concentration in MCM</span></h2>
<p>MCM supports two main undergraduate concentrations, <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/undergraduate/mcm-track-i">Track I</a> and <a href="http://brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/undergraduate/mcm-track-ii">Track II</a>.</p>
<p>Track I consists of 11 MCM courses. Courses from other departments may count toward the fulfillment of a focus area, and must be approved by an MCM concentration advisor as part of a coherent program of study.</p>
<p>Track II concentration consists of 11 courses distributed as follows: two core courses, two additional courses below the 1000-level, three 1000-level courses, four production courses, and one senior seminar. Students are expected to meet regularly with their concentration advisors; they are required to meet at the beginning of their seventh semester to review their concentrations.<span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<h2><span>Double Concentrations &nbsp;</span></h2>
<p><span>Students who declare a double concentration may count up to two courses for concentration credit in MCM that are also counted towards concentration credit in another department or program.</span></p>
<h2><span style="color:#2f2a20">Undergraduate Advisor 2017-2018</span></h2>
<p>Anthony Cokes<br /><a href="mailto:Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu">Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu</a></p>
<p><strong>Please Note:&nbsp;</strong>Students who have already declared a concentration using the paper form must revise that concentration and add additional concentrations by using the paper form.&nbsp;<a href="http://brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/uploads/concentrationform.pdf" target="_blank">Paper Concentration forms&nbsp;</a></p>
<p>If you have not already declared a concentration using this form, please use the <a href="https://apps.college.brown.edu/ask/">online declaration form</a>.</p>
<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-files"><legend>Related Files</legend><div class="field field-type-filefield field-field-related-files">
    <div class="field-items">
            <div class="field-item odd">

        </div>
</div>
</fieldset>
  </div>

          <li class="first"><a href="/gateway/current-students" rel="nofollow">Current Students</a></li>

          <li><a href="/gateway/staff" rel="nofollow">Staff</a></li>
          <li><a href="/gateway/families" rel="nofollow">Families</a></li>
          <li><a href="/gateway/alumni" rel="nofollow">Alumni</a></li>
          <li class="last"><a href="/gateway/friends-and-neighbors" rel="nofollow">Friends &amp; Neighbors</a></li>
        </ul>
        </div>
 		</nav>
        </div>
  </section>
    <section id="audience-gateways">
      <div class="marginator">
      	<div id="information-for">

	<div id="block-ultibanner-0" class="clear-block block block-ultibanner ">

	<!--div id="node-1078" class="ultibanner banner"-->
		<img  class="imagefield imagefield-field_ultibanner_image" width="940" height="300" alt="" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/ultibanner/ursa_minor_robust_banner_image.jpg?1467310782" />	<!--/div-->

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Resources for undergraduates</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-1190" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h4>Resources for undergraduates</h4>
<p class="p1">Students are encouraged to visit faculty and TAs during office hours, to attend problem sessions, and to access other departmental resources for learning, whether or not they are experiencing any academic difficulty.<span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="p1">Brown's Dean of the College office provides academic support that supplements the support provided by course instructors. That office, along with the Office of Student Life, provides an array of support services; please see <span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/">https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/</a></span> and <a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-life/"><span style="text-decoration:underline">https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-life/</span> </a>for information.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="p1">Students needing help with writing and English language learning will find robust support in Brown's Writing Center, which offers one-on-one conferences as well as workshops on writing and communicating in English. Individual support is available for all students at Brown. To contact the Brown Writing Center, please see <span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/writing/">https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/writing/</a></span>.</p>
<p class="p1">Brown University is committed to full inclusion of all students. Please inform your instructors if there are conditions that might require accommodations or modification of course procedures for you.&nbsp; For more information, please contact Student and Employee Accessibility Services at 401-863-9588 or <a href="mailto:SEAS@brown.edu">SEAS@brown.edu</a>.</p>
<p class="p1">The Office of Institutional Diversity and Inclusion works to promote a diverse and inclusive community at Brown.&nbsp; If you have any concerns about these issues or would like to know about their resources, please see<span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/institutional-diversity/resources-initiatives"> https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/institutional-diversity/resources-initiatives</a></span>.&nbsp; If you have concerns about sexual and gender-based discrimination, harassment, and/or violence, please contact Brown's Title IX office; see <span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/title-ix/">https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/title-ix/</a></span>.</p>
<p class="p1">Click on the links below to learn more about the services that will help you achieve your academic goals.</p>
<h3>Academic Resources:</h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/academic-coaching-and-workshops/academic-coaching-and-workshops">Academic Support Services&nbsp;<br /> </a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/curricular-resource-center/">Curricular Resource Center&nbsp;&nbsp;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/">Dean of the College</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/curricular-resource-center/departmental-undergraduate-groups/departmental-undergraduate-groups">Departmental Undergraduate Groups (DUGs)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/special-programs/international-study/">Office of International Programs</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/peer-advising">Peer Advising&nbsp;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/science-center/">Science Center</a></li>
<li><span><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/tutor">Tutoring</a></span></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/writing">Writing Center</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 class="p1"><span style="color:#2f2a20">Diversity Centers, Programs, and Resources:</span></h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/students-of-color/alana">ALANA Mentoring Program for African American, Latino, Asian/Asian American, and Native American students</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/lgbtq/">LGBTQ Center</a><span>&nbsp;</span></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/students-of-color/mpc">Minority Peer Counseling Program</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/spiritual-life/chaplains/">Office of the Chaplains and Religious Life</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/institutional-diversity/">Office of Institutional Diversity and Inclusion</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/veterans-and-commissioning-programs/">Office of Student Veterans and Commissioning Programs</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/apply/resumed-undergraduate-education-applicants">Resumed Undergraduate Education Program</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/sarah-doyle-center/">Sarah Doyle Women's Center</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/accessibility-services/">Student and Employee Accessibility Services</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/title-ix/">Title X and Gender Equity</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/transfer-students">Transfer Students</a></li>
<li><a href="//www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/students-of-color/twtp" rel="nofollow">Third World Transition Program</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>International Student Advising and Support:</h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="//www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/international-mentoring-program/" rel="nofollow">International Mentoring Program</a></li>
<li><a href="//www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/international-students/" rel="nofollow">International Students Resources</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/international-student-and-scholar-services/">Office of International Student and Scholar Services&nbsp;</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Health and Wellness:</h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Student_Services/Health_Services/">Brown Health Services</a><span>&nbsp;</span></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/health/services/promotion/">B Well Health Promotion</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/counseling-and-psychological-services/home">Counseling and Psychological Services</a></li>
<li><a href="//www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-life/student-support-services/medical-leaves" rel="nofollow">Medical Leaves</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/substance-abuse/dean-issues-chemical-dependency">Substance Abuse</a></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>MCM:</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/diversity-and-inclusion-initiatives/resources">MCM Diversity and Inclusion      Initiative</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/undergraduate/mcm-dug">MCM DUG</a></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>Safety:</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/health/services/promotion/sexual-assault-dating-violence-get-help-how-help-friend/share-advocates">Sexual Harassment &amp; Assault Resources &amp; Education Advocates</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/vp-campus-life/sexual-assault ">Sexual Assault, Harassment, Relationship Violence Resources</a></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>Other Campus Life Resources</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/financial-advising">Financial Advising</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/housing-and-dining/residential-life/">Office of Residential Life&nbsp;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-life/student-support-services">Student Support Services&nbsp;</a></li>
</ul>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>

		<div class="content"><div class="view view-contact-information view-id-contact_information view-display-id-block_1 view-dom-id-1">
    
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last">
    <div class="vcard">

        <div class="item-list">		
                             	<h3 class="current-site"><a href="">Modern Culture and Media</a></h3>
            
      
        <div class="list">
        
	
	<div class="block-menu-primary-links clear-block block block-menu ">
	
		
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-home"><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/welcome-department-modern-culture-and-media" title="Home">Home</a></li>

		<img  class="imagefield imagefield-field_ultibanner_image" width="940" height="300" alt="" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/ultibanner/ursa_minor_robust_banner_image.jpg?1467310782" />	<!--/div-->

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>

  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Resources for undergraduates</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-1190" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h4>Resources for undergraduates</h4>
<p class="p1">Students are encouraged to visit faculty and TAs during office hours, to attend problem sessions, and to access other departmental resources for learning, whether or not they are experiencing any academic difficulty.<span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="p1">Brown's Dean of the College office provides academic support that supplements the support provided by course instructors. That office, along with the Office of Student Life, provides an array of support services; please see <span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/">https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/</a></span> and <a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-life/"><span style="text-decoration:underline">https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-life/</span> </a>for information.&nbsp;</p>
<p class="p1">Students needing help with writing and English language learning will find robust support in Brown's Writing Center, which offers one-on-one conferences as well as workshops on writing and communicating in English. Individual support is available for all students at Brown. To contact the Brown Writing Center, please see <span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/writing/">https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/writing/</a></span>.</p>
<p class="p1">Brown University is committed to full inclusion of all students. Please inform your instructors if there are conditions that might require accommodations or modification of course procedures for you.&nbsp; For more information, please contact Student and Employee Accessibility Services at 401-863-9588 or <a href="mailto:SEAS@brown.edu">SEAS@brown.edu</a>.</p>
<p class="p1">The Office of Institutional Diversity and Inclusion works to promote a diverse and inclusive community at Brown.&nbsp; If you have any concerns about these issues or would like to know about their resources, please see<span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/institutional-diversity/resources-initiatives"> https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/institutional-diversity/resources-initiatives</a></span>.&nbsp; If you have concerns about sexual and gender-based discrimination, harassment, and/or violence, please contact Brown's Title IX office; see <span style="text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/title-ix/">https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/title-ix/</a></span>.</p>
<p class="p1">Click on the links below to learn more about the services that will help you achieve your academic goals.</p>
<h3>Academic Resources:</h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/academic-coaching-and-workshops/academic-coaching-and-workshops">Academic Support Services&nbsp;<br /> </a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/curricular-resource-center/">Curricular Resource Center&nbsp;&nbsp;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/">Dean of the College</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/curricular-resource-center/departmental-undergraduate-groups/departmental-undergraduate-groups">Departmental Undergraduate Groups (DUGs)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/special-programs/international-study/">Office of International Programs</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/peer-advising">Peer Advising&nbsp;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/science-center/">Science Center</a></li>
<li><span><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/tutor">Tutoring</a></span></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/writing">Writing Center</a></li>
</ul>
<h3 class="p1"><span style="color:#2f2a20">Diversity Centers, Programs, and Resources:</span></h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/students-of-color/alana">ALANA Mentoring Program for African American, Latino, Asian/Asian American, and Native American students</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/lgbtq/">LGBTQ Center</a><span>&nbsp;</span></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/students-of-color/mpc">Minority Peer Counseling Program</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/spiritual-life/chaplains/">Office of the Chaplains and Religious Life</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/institutional-diversity/">Office of Institutional Diversity and Inclusion</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/veterans-and-commissioning-programs/">Office of Student Veterans and Commissioning Programs</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/apply/resumed-undergraduate-education-applicants">Resumed Undergraduate Education Program</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/sarah-doyle-center/">Sarah Doyle Women's Center</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/accessibility-services/">Student and Employee Accessibility Services</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/title-ix/">Title X and Gender Equity</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/transfer-students">Transfer Students</a></li>
<li><a href="//www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/students-of-color/twtp" rel="nofollow">Third World Transition Program</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>International Student Advising and Support:</h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="//www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/international-mentoring-program/" rel="nofollow">International Mentoring Program</a></li>
<li><a href="//www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/international-students/" rel="nofollow">International Students Resources</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/international-student-and-scholar-services/">Office of International Student and Scholar Services&nbsp;</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Health and Wellness:</h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://www.brown.edu/Student_Services/Health_Services/">Brown Health Services</a><span>&nbsp;</span></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/health/services/promotion/">B Well Health Promotion</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/support/counseling-and-psychological-services/home">Counseling and Psychological Services</a></li>
<li><a href="//www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-life/student-support-services/medical-leaves" rel="nofollow">Medical Leaves</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/support/substance-abuse/dean-issues-chemical-dependency">Substance Abuse</a></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>MCM:</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/diversity-and-inclusion-initiatives/resources">MCM Diversity and Inclusion      Initiative</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/undergraduate/mcm-dug">MCM DUG</a></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>Safety:</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/health/services/promotion/sexual-assault-dating-violence-get-help-how-help-friend/share-advocates">Sexual Harassment &amp; Assault Resources &amp; Education Advocates</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/vp-campus-life/sexual-assault ">Sexual Assault, Harassment, Relationship Violence Resources</a></li>
</ul>
<h3><strong>Other Campus Life Resources</strong></h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/advising/financial-advising">Financial Advising</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/campus-life/housing-and-dining/residential-life/">Office of Residential Life&nbsp;</a></li>
<li><a href="https://www.brown.edu/about/administration/student-life/student-support-services">Student Support Services&nbsp;</a></li>
</ul>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">

          <li><a href="https://twitter.com/BrownUniversity" title="Twitter" id="footer-twitter">Twitter</a></li>

		<div class="content">



	<!--div id="node-1078" class="ultibanner banner"-->
		<img  class="imagefield imagefield-field_ultibanner_image" width="940" height="300" alt="" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/ultibanner/ursa_minor_robust_banner_image.jpg?1467310782" />	<!--/div-->

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Honors in Modern Culture and Media</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-192" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><strong>Honors Director for 2017-2018</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="2">Professor Anthony Cokes</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Students wishing to culminate the concentration with a thesis and receive the degree with Honors may apply for department approval to produce a creative, critical, or theoretical work in the senior year.</p>
<p>The thesis experience allows a student to get to know, and work closely with, a faculty member. The MCM Honors Program is intellectually demanding and time-consuming; students should be willing to devote a substantial part of their senior year to the thesis. Students work under the guidance of a department faculty advisor and second reader. Where appropriate, the advisor or the reader, but not both, may be in another department.</p>
<h3></h3>
<ul>
</ul>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>
        <!-- end .second-column -->

		<img  class="imagefield imagefield-field_ultibanner_image" width="940" height="300" alt="" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/ultibanner/ursa_minor_robust_banner_image.jpg?1467310782" />	<!--/div-->

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Honors in Modern Culture and Media</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-192" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td colspan="2"><strong>Honors Director for 2017-2018</strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="2">Professor Anthony Cokes</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Students wishing to culminate the concentration with a thesis and receive the degree with Honors may apply for department approval to produce a creative, critical, or theoretical work in the senior year.</p>
<p>The thesis experience allows a student to get to know, and work closely with, a faculty member. The MCM Honors Program is intellectually demanding and time-consuming; students should be willing to devote a substantial part of their senior year to the thesis. Students work under the guidance of a department faculty advisor and second reader. Where appropriate, the advisor or the reader, but not both, may be in another department.</p>
<h3></h3>
<ul>
</ul>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>

            <div id="sidebar-right" class="sidebar third-column column"> 
	
	<div id="university-calendar" class="clear-block block block-calwidget ">
	
	<h2>University Calendar</h2>	
		<div class="content"><section class="events-list">
      <div class="date">

          03        </span></h5>

              <li class="event  even">

        </ul>

        <div class="item-list">

        <div class="list">
        
	
	<div class="block-menu-primary-links clear-block block block-menu ">

	<div class="block-views-contact_information-block_1 clear-block block block-views ">
	
		
		<div class="content"><div class="view view-contact-information view-id-contact_information view-display-id-block_1 view-dom-id-1">
    
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last">
    <div class="vcard">

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Advisor and Readers</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-259" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h2><span class="style2">Advisors&nbsp;</span></h2>
<p>All theses must have a <em>primary thesis advisor</em> and <em>second reader</em>. By the end of their seventh semester, honor candidates must submit to the department the name of a 2nd reader.&nbsp;<em>&nbsp;*please note the advisor or the 2nd reader, but not both, may be outside of the MCM department. MCM Affliliated Faculty are considered part of the MCM faculty roster and don't count as "outside the department." </em></p>
<p><em>MCM Affiliated faculty are: Timothy Bewes (ENGL), Anthony Bogues (AFRI), Jacques Khalip (ENGL), Massimo Riva (ITAL), Richard Rambuss (ENGL), Rebecca Schneider (TAPS), Suzanne Stewart-Steinberg (COLT &amp; ITAL) and Lingzhen Wang (EAST).</em><br /><br />The respective responsibilities of the Thesis Advisor and 2nd reader are outlined below.</p>
<h2 class="style2">Primary Thesis Advisor</h2>
<ul>
<li>Establishing work schedules with advisees and helping set deadlines for completed work</li>
<li>Meeting with advisee on regular basis</li>
<li>Helping plan and organize research</li>
<li>Reading research reports and drafts of chapter</li>
<li>Approving final version of the thesis</li>
<li>Submitting written reports summarizing assessment of the thesis at the end of the 8th semester to the Undergraduate honors director</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="style2">Second reader:</h2>
<ul>
<li>Establish their role after consultation with the advisor and advisee</li>
<li>May discuss research and read drafts of chapters</li>
<li>Read and approve finished version of the thesis&nbsp;</li>
<li>Submitting written reports summarizing assessment of the thesis at the end of the 8th semester to the Undergraduate honors director</li>
</ul>
<h2>
<hr />
Evaluation of thesis</h2>
<p><strong>Readers' comments should include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><span><span>comments on the quality of thesis</span></span></li>
<li>a brief description &nbsp;of the student's goals in pursuing his/her project</li>
<li>evaluation of his/her success in achieving these goals</li>
<li>brief description and evaluation of the student's work in the<em> concentration,</em> if they are in a position to do so</li>
<li><em>The primary thesis</em> advisor should <span class="highlight">include a grade</span> with his/her comments</li>
</ul>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Advisor and Readers</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-259" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h2><span class="style2">Advisors&nbsp;</span></h2>
<p>All theses must have a <em>primary thesis advisor</em> and <em>second reader</em>. By the end of their seventh semester, honor candidates must submit to the department the name of a 2nd reader.&nbsp;<em>&nbsp;*please note the advisor or the 2nd reader, but not both, may be outside of the MCM department. MCM Affliliated Faculty are considered part of the MCM faculty roster and don't count as "outside the department." </em></p>
<p><em>MCM Affiliated faculty are: Timothy Bewes (ENGL), Anthony Bogues (AFRI), Jacques Khalip (ENGL), Massimo Riva (ITAL), Richard Rambuss (ENGL), Rebecca Schneider (TAPS), Suzanne Stewart-Steinberg (COLT &amp; ITAL) and Lingzhen Wang (EAST).</em><br /><br />The respective responsibilities of the Thesis Advisor and 2nd reader are outlined below.</p>
<h2 class="style2">Primary Thesis Advisor</h2>
<ul>
<li>Establishing work schedules with advisees and helping set deadlines for completed work</li>
<li>Meeting with advisee on regular basis</li>
<li>Helping plan and organize research</li>
<li>Reading research reports and drafts of chapter</li>
<li>Approving final version of the thesis</li>
<li>Submitting written reports summarizing assessment of the thesis at the end of the 8th semester to the Undergraduate honors director</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="style2">Second reader:</h2>
<ul>
<li>Establish their role after consultation with the advisor and advisee</li>
<li>May discuss research and read drafts of chapters</li>
<li>Read and approve finished version of the thesis&nbsp;</li>
<li>Submitting written reports summarizing assessment of the thesis at the end of the 8th semester to the Undergraduate honors director</li>
</ul>
<h2>
<hr />
Evaluation of thesis</h2>
<p><strong>Readers' comments should include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><span><span>comments on the quality of thesis</span></span></li>
<li>a brief description &nbsp;of the student's goals in pursuing his/her project</li>
<li>evaluation of his/her success in achieving these goals</li>
<li>brief description and evaluation of the student's work in the<em> concentration,</em> if they are in a position to do so</li>
<li><em>The primary thesis</em> advisor should <span class="highlight">include a grade</span> with his/her comments</li>
</ul>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>
 </div>
                     </div>

                <div id="sidebar-left" class="sidebar first-column column">
                      <h5>Also in Modern Culture and Media</h5>
         		
	
	<div class="block-menu-primary-links clear-block block block-menu ">

    <section id="audience-gateways">
      <div class="marginator">
      	<div id="information-for">
        <h6>Information For:</h6>
        <ul>

	<!--div id="node-1078" class="ultibanner banner"-->
		<img  class="imagefield imagefield-field_ultibanner_image" width="940" height="300" alt="" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/ultibanner/ursa_minor_robust_banner_image.jpg?1467310782" />	<!--/div-->

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Honors Application</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-258" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>Qualified students should start thinking about their topic and thesis committee well before the application deadline. Because the thesis is the student’s individual research project and not one assigned by a faculty member for a course, students should spend some time formulating a research topic and research question prior to soliciting a thesis advisor. Interested students are also encouraged to discuss their ideas with the MCM undergraduate honors director.</p>
<h2>The application must include the following:</h2>
<ol>
<li>Detailed description (1-2 pages) of the honors thesis project</li>
<li>Bibliography (1 page)</li>
<li>Up-to-date transcript (Banner printout is acceptable). The transcript must indicate A-level work in at least half of the concentration courses. For S/NC courses, statements from relevant faculty members&nbsp;<br />certifying that work was of Honors quality are required</li>
<li>Signature of primary faculty advisor*</li>
<li>Name of second reader* (if not known at time of application, student must choose a 2<sup>nd</sup><span> reader by October 15.)</span></li>
</ol>
<p><span>Students who qualify for&nbsp;</span><span class="il">Honors</span><span>&nbsp;are eligible to apply to do an&nbsp;</span><span class="il">Honors</span><span>&nbsp;project or thesis. Students should submit a letter of intent in their 6</span><sup>th</sup><span>&nbsp;semester, and a formal proposal, by the first day of their 7</span><sup>th</sup><span>&nbsp;semester.&nbsp; Applications will be screened by the MCM&nbsp;</span><span class="il">Honors</span><span>&nbsp;Committee. (Application forms are available in the MCM office.) If approved, a student must then register for MCM1970, a one credit course which can count towards their Focus Area requirements, and MCM1990, a one-credit thesis course in which they complete the&nbsp;</span><span class="il">Honors</span><span>&nbsp;project/thesis.&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong>Applications are due in MCM on the first day of class, of the Fall semester, of the senior year (for mid-year graduates, the due date is the last Friday in February of the 7th semester).</strong><span>&nbsp;Proposals will be reviewed by the MCM Honors Director and students will be notified within one month.</span><br /><br /><br /></p>
<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-files"><legend>Related Files</legend><div class="field field-type-filefield field-field-related-files">
    <div class="field-items">
            <div class="field-item odd">
                    <div class="filefield-file"><img class="filefield-icon field-icon-application-pdf"  alt="application/pdf icon" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/all/modules/filefield/icons/application-pdf.png" /><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/uploads/Honors%20Application_REVISED2_track%20II_0.pdf" type="application/pdf; length=178590">Honors Application_REVISED2_track II.pdf</a></div>        </div>
              <div class="field-item even">
                    <div class="filefield-file"><img class="filefield-icon field-icon-application-pdf"  alt="application/pdf icon" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/all/modules/filefield/icons/application-pdf.png" /><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/uploads/Honors%20Application_REVISED2_track%20I_0.pdf" type="application/pdf; length=166852">Honors Application_REVISED2_track I.pdf</a></div>        </div>
        </div>
</div>
</fieldset>
  </div>

	</div>

          <li class="leaf"><a href="https://gifts.brown.edu/" id="dhtml_menu-669">Make a Gift</a></li>
          <li class="leaf last"><a href="http://directory.brown.edu" id="dhtml_menu-671">People Directory</a></li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>
    

	
	<div id="find-mcm-" class="clear-block block block-menu ">
	
	<h5>Find MCM!</h5>	
		<div class="content"><ul class="menu"><li class="leaf first menu-followusonfacebook"><a href="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Modern-Culture-and-Media-at-Brown-University/160606754025493" title="">Follow us on Facebook!</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-155georgestreetmainoffice"><a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?q=155+George+Street+Providence+RI&amp;hl=en&amp;ll=41.825588,-71.399524&amp;spn=0.012152,0.015063&amp;sll=41.826269," title="">155 George Street (Main Office)</a></li>
<li class="leaf last menu-135thayerstreet"><a href="http://maps.google.com/maps?q=135+Thayer+Street+Providence+RI&amp;hl=en&amp;ll=41.82498,-71.400082&amp;spn=0.012152,0.015063&amp;sll=41.825588,-" title="">135 Thayer Street</a></li>
</ul></div>
			
				
	</div>

       	<h3><a href="">m.Brown.edu</a></h3>
        <div class="list">

		<div class="content">



	<!--div id="node-1078" class="ultibanner banner"-->
		<img  class="imagefield imagefield-field_ultibanner_image" width="940" height="300" alt="" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/ultibanner/ursa_minor_robust_banner_image.jpg?1467310782" />	<!--/div-->

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Honors Application</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-258" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <p>Qualified students should start thinking about their topic and thesis committee well before the application deadline. Because the thesis is the student’s individual research project and not one assigned by a faculty member for a course, students should spend some time formulating a research topic and research question prior to soliciting a thesis advisor. Interested students are also encouraged to discuss their ideas with the MCM undergraduate honors director.</p>
<h2>The application must include the following:</h2>
<ol>
<li>Detailed description (1-2 pages) of the honors thesis project</li>
<li>Bibliography (1 page)</li>
<li>Up-to-date transcript (Banner printout is acceptable). The transcript must indicate A-level work in at least half of the concentration courses. For S/NC courses, statements from relevant faculty members&nbsp;<br />certifying that work was of Honors quality are required</li>
<li>Signature of primary faculty advisor*</li>
<li>Name of second reader* (if not known at time of application, student must choose a 2<sup>nd</sup><span> reader by October 15.)</span></li>
</ol>
<p><span>Students who qualify for&nbsp;</span><span class="il">Honors</span><span>&nbsp;are eligible to apply to do an&nbsp;</span><span class="il">Honors</span><span>&nbsp;project or thesis. Students should submit a letter of intent in their 6</span><sup>th</sup><span>&nbsp;semester, and a formal proposal, by the first day of their 7</span><sup>th</sup><span>&nbsp;semester.&nbsp; Applications will be screened by the MCM&nbsp;</span><span class="il">Honors</span><span>&nbsp;Committee. (Application forms are available in the MCM office.) If approved, a student must then register for MCM1970, a one credit course which can count towards their Focus Area requirements, and MCM1990, a one-credit thesis course in which they complete the&nbsp;</span><span class="il">Honors</span><span>&nbsp;project/thesis.&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><strong>Applications are due in MCM on the first day of class, of the Fall semester, of the senior year (for mid-year graduates, the due date is the last Friday in February of the 7th semester).</strong><span>&nbsp;Proposals will be reviewed by the MCM Honors Director and students will be notified within one month.</span><br /><br /><br /></p>
<fieldset class="fieldgroup group-related-files"><legend>Related Files</legend><div class="field field-type-filefield field-field-related-files">
    <div class="field-items">
            <div class="field-item odd">

              <div class="field-item even">
                    <div class="filefield-file"><img class="filefield-icon field-icon-application-pdf"  alt="application/pdf icon" src="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/all/modules/filefield/icons/application-pdf.png" /><a href="https://www.brown.edu/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/brown.edu.academics.modern-culture-and-media/files/uploads/Honors%20Application_REVISED2_track%20I_0.pdf" type="application/pdf; length=166852">Honors Application_REVISED2_track I.pdf</a></div>        </div>
        </div>

</fieldset>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">

	</div>

</article>

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
	  
  <!-- Layout -->
  <div id="content">
    <div class="marginator">
                  <div class="columns main-columns">
        <h1 class="article-title  with-tabs">Honors Timeline</h1>                        <div id="body-content" class="second-column column main-column">
                                                  <div class="clear-block"> 
<article id="node-261" class="main-article node">








  <div class="content">
        <h2></h2>
<ul>
</ul>
<h2></h2>
<p><span><span><br /></span></span></p>
<h2>December 2017 Graduate Deadlines (Current Seniors)</h2>
<ul>
<li><span>October 15, 2016 -&nbsp;As a junior concentrator, submit your&nbsp;<em>Letter of Intent</em>&nbsp;to your First Reader in 6th semester. Once you get approval from the faculty member that will serve as your First Reader, please forward&nbsp;<em>approval email</em>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>Letter of Intent&nbsp;</em>to Director of Honors, <a href="mailto:Ellen_Rooney@brown.edu">Ellen_Rooney@brown.edu</a> and the Program Coordinator, Liza_Hebert@brown.edu</span></li>
<li><span>November 8, 2016 -&nbsp;Honors Director will contact student to confirm pre-registration in MCM1970. (end of pre-registration period)</span></li>
<li><span>January 25, 2017 -&nbsp;Student submits formal&nbsp;<em>Honors Proposal&nbsp;</em>by 1st day of classes of the 7th semester.</span></li>
<li><span>February 7, 2017 -&nbsp;Student is notified if their honors proposal is approved (last day to add a course w/out a fee)</span></li>
<li><span>March 15, 2017 - Student submits name of 2nd reader to Liza Hebert</span></li>
<li><span>&nbsp;May 1, 2017 - &nbsp;First chapter/first stage due (students who meet goal may proceed with honors thesis)&nbsp;</span></li>
<li class="highlight"><span>September 6 - 19, 2017 - &nbsp;Student registers for MCM1990&nbsp;<em>Honors Thesis/Project<br />After September 6, student meets with advisor and second reader to develop timeline</em></span></li>
<li class="highlight">December 1, 2017 - Final bound thesis or Final creative project &nbsp;due to advisor and second reader</li>
<li class="highlight">January 4, 2018 - Advisor and 2nd Reader Report due to Honors director</li>
</ul>
<p><em>January 4, 2018, 5pm</em><span>&nbsp;- Grade must be entered for the honor student enrolled in&nbsp;</span><em>MCM1990 Honors Thesis/Project in Modern Culture and Media</em></p>
<hr />
<ul>
</ul>
<h2>May 2018 Gradaute Deadlines (Current Seniors)</h2>
<p>In&nbsp;order to pre-register for the&nbsp;MCM Honors preparation course (MCM1970) in the ​<span>fall semester of your senior year, you will need to secure a faculty advisor in the spring semester of your junior year.​ After a preliminary meeting to discuss your topic, you should submit a&nbsp;</span><em>Letter of Intent</em><span>&nbsp;to your advisor applying to&nbsp;write a thesis. The deadline for submitting this letter is&nbsp;15 April.&nbsp; Your faculty advisor will approve your application by the end of April, and the Honors Director will contact you to confirm your registration in MCM1970.&nbsp;<span>&nbsp;Once you get approval from the faculty member that will serve as your First Reader, please forward&nbsp;</span><em>approval email</em><span>&nbsp;and&nbsp;</span><em>Letter of Intent&nbsp;</em><span>to Director of Honors, <a href="mailto:Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu">Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu</a> and the Program Coordinator, Liza_Hebert@brown.edu</span><br /><br /></span><strong>​</strong><span>The</span><strong>&nbsp;​</strong><span> </span><strong>LETTER OF INTENT</strong><span>&nbsp;is a prelude to your Honors Thesis proposal. This letter should​ present a brief description of your thesis​ project. The​ description should be only a paragraph or two in length​ and provide your reader with a sense of your topic and your plans for beginning your work.&nbsp;(The Letter of Intent is not a substitute for the thesis proposal, which you will submit in the fall.)</span></p>
<ul>
<li>April 15, 2017 - Junior concentrator submits&nbsp;<em>Letter of Intent</em>&nbsp;to faculty advisor, serving as their first reader, in 6th semester.&nbsp;Once you get approval from the faculty member that will serve as your First Reader, please forward&nbsp;<em>approval email&nbsp;</em>from your first reader&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>Letter of Intent&nbsp;</em>to Director of Honors, <a href="mailto:Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu">Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu</a> and the Program Coordinator, <a href="mailto:Liza_Hebert@brown.edu">Liza_Hebert@brown.edu</a></li>
<li>April 25, 2017 - Honors director will contact student to confirm pre-registration in MCM1970.&nbsp;&nbsp;<span>(last day to add a course w/out a fee)</span></li>
<li><span>April 25, 2017 - Student pre-registers for MCM1970 Independent Study for Fall 2017&nbsp;</span></li>
<li><span>September 6, 2017 - Student submits formal&nbsp;<em>Honors Propsoal</em>&nbsp;by 1st day of classes of the 7th semester</span></li>
<li><span>September 19, 2017 - Student is notified if their honors proposal is approved (last day to add a course w/out a fee)</span></li>
<li>October 15, 2017 - Students submits the name of 2nd reader to Liza Hebert</li>
<li><span>December 1, 2017 - First Chapter/First Stage due&nbsp;<span>(students who meet goal may proceed with honors thesis)&nbsp;</span></span></li>
<li><span>January 24 - February 6, 2018 - Student registers for MCM1990&nbsp;<em>Honors Thesis/ Project&nbsp;<br />After January 24, student meets with advisor and second reader to develop time line&nbsp;</em></span></li>
<li><span>April 15, 2018 - Final bound thesis or Final creative project due to advisor and second reader</span></li>
<li><span>April 22, 2018- Advisor and 2nd Reader Report due to Honors director</span></li>
<li><span>May 1, 2018 - Honors Director Report due to College Curriculum Council + student notified of honors status by Honors Director</span></li>
<li><span>May 27, 2018 - Student receives diploma indicating degree with honors!!!<br />
<hr />
</span></li>
</ul>
<h2></h2>
<ul>
</ul>
<!-- p.p1 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 21.0px Helvetica; color: #2f2a20; -webkit-text-stroke: #2f2a20} p.p2 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 14.0px Georgia; color: #2f2a20; -webkit-text-stroke: #2f2a20} li.li2 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 14.0px Georgia; color: #2f2a20; -webkit-text-stroke: #2f2a20} span.s1 {font-kerning: none} span.s2 {font: 14.0px Georgia; font-kerning: none; color: #c01904; -webkit-text-stroke: 0px #c01904} ul.ul1 {list-style-type: disc} --><!-- p.p1 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 21.0px Helvetica; color: #2f2a20; -webkit-text-stroke: #2f2a20} p.p2 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 14.0px Georgia; color: #2f2a20; -webkit-text-stroke: #2f2a20} li.li2 {margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 14.0px Georgia; color: #2f2a20; -webkit-text-stroke: #2f2a20} span.s1 {font-kerning: none} span.s2 {font: 14.0px Georgia; font-kerning: none; color: #c01904; -webkit-text-stroke: 0px #c01904} ul.ul1 {list-style-type: disc} --><h2 class="p1"><span class="s1">December 2018 Graduate Deadlines (Current Juniors)</span></h2>
<ul class="ul1">
<li class="li2"><span class="s1">October 15, 2017 -&nbsp;As a junior concentrator, submit your&nbsp;<em>Letter of Intent</em>&nbsp;to your First Reader in 6th semester. Once you get approval from the faculty member that will serve as your First Reader, please forward&nbsp;<em>approval email</em>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>Letter of Intent&nbsp;</em>to Director of Honors, Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu&nbsp;and the Program Coordinator, Liza_Hebert@brown.edu</span></li>
<li class="li2"><span class="s1">November 14, 2017 -&nbsp;Honors Director will contact student to confirm pre-registration in MCM1970. (end of pre-registration period)</span></li>
<li class="li2"><span class="s1">January 24, 2018 -&nbsp;Student submits formal&nbsp;<em>Honors Proposal&nbsp;</em>by 1st day of classes of the 7th semester.</span></li>
<li class="li2"><span class="s1">February 6, 2018 -&nbsp;Student is notified if their honors proposal is approved (Last day to add a course without a fee)</span></li>
<li class="li2"><span class="s1">March 15, 2018 - Student submits name of 2nd reader to Liza Hebert</span></li>
<li class="li2"><span class="s1">&nbsp;May 1, 2018 - &nbsp;First chapter/first stage due (students who meet goal may proceed with honors thesis)&nbsp;</span></li>
<li class="li2"><span class="s1">September xx - xx, 2018 - &nbsp;Student registers for MCM1990&nbsp;<em>Honors Thesis/Project (Registartion dates TBD)</em></span></li>
<li class="li2"><em>&nbsp;</em><span class="s1"><em>After September 6, student meets with advisor and second reader to develop timeline</em></span></li>
<li class="li2"><span class="s1">December 1, 2018 - Final bound thesis or Final creative project due to advisor</span></li>
<li class="li2"><span class="s1">January 4, 2019 - Advisor and 2nd Reader Report due to Honors director</span></li>
</ul>
<p class="p2"><span class="s1"><em>January 4, 2019, 5pm</em>&nbsp;- Grade must be entered for the honor student enrolled in&nbsp;<em>MCM1990 Honors Thesis/Project in Modern Culture and Media</em></span></p>
<p class="p2"><span class="s1"><em>&nbsp;</em></span></p>
<hr />
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<h2>May 2019 Gradaute Deadlines (Current Juniors)</h2>
<p>In&nbsp;order to pre-register for the&nbsp;MCM Honors preparation course (MCM1970) in the ​<span>fall semester of your senior year, you will need to secure a faculty advisor in the spring semester of your junior year.​ After a preliminary meeting to discuss your topic, you should submit a&nbsp;</span><em>Letter of Intent</em><span>&nbsp;to your advisor applying to&nbsp;write a thesis. The deadline for submitting this letter is&nbsp;15 April.&nbsp; Your faculty advisor will approve your application by the end of April, and the Honors Director will contact you to confirm your registration in MCM1970.&nbsp;&nbsp;Once you get approval from the faculty member that will serve as your First Reader, please forward&nbsp;<em>approval email</em>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>Letter of Intent&nbsp;</em>to Director of Honors, <a href="mailto:Ellen_Rooney@brown.edu">Ellen_Rooney@brown.edu</a> and the Program Coordinator, <a href="mailto:Liza_Hebert@brown.edu">Liza_Hebert@brown.edu</a><br /><br /></span><strong>​</strong><span>The</span><strong>&nbsp;​</strong><span>&nbsp;</span><strong>LETTER OF INTENT</strong><span>&nbsp;is a prelude to your Honors Thesis proposal. This letter should​ present a brief description of your thesis​ project. The​ description should be only a paragraph or two in length​ and provide your reader with a sense of your topic and your plans for beginning your work.&nbsp;(The Letter of Intent is not a substitute for the thesis proposal, which you will submit in the fall.)</span></p>
<ul>
<li>April 15, 2018 - Junior concentrator submits&nbsp;<em>Letter of Intent</em>&nbsp;to faculty advisor, serving as their first reader, in 6th semester.&nbsp;Once you get approval from the faculty member that will serve as your First Reader, please forward&nbsp;<em>approval email&nbsp;</em>from your first reader&nbsp;and&nbsp;<em>Letter of Intent&nbsp;</em>to Director of Honors, <a href="mailto:Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu">Anthony_Cokes@brown.edu</a> and the Program Coordinator, <a href="mailto:Liza_Hebert@brown.edu">Liza_Hebert@brown.edu</a></li>
<li>April 24, 2018 - Honors director will contact student to confirm pre-registration in MCM1970.&nbsp;&nbsp;(last day to add a course w/out a fee)</li>
<li>April 24, 2018 - Student pre-registers for MCM1970 Independent Study for Fall 2017&nbsp;</li>
<li>September 5, 2018 - Student submits formal&nbsp;<em>Honors Propsoal</em>&nbsp;by 1st day of classes of the 7th semester</li>
<li>September 18, 2018 - Student is notified if their honors proposal is approved (last day to add a course w/out a fee)</li>
<li>October 15, 2018 - Students submits the name of 2nd reader to Liza Hebert</li>
<li>December 1, 2018 - First Chapter/First Stage due&nbsp;(students who meet goal may proceed with honors thesis)&nbsp;</li>
<li>January 23 - February 5, 2019 - Student registers for MCM1990&nbsp;<em>Honors Thesis/ Project&nbsp;<br />After January 23, student meets with advisor and second reader to develop time line&nbsp;</em></li>
<li><span>April 15, 2019 - Final bound thesis or Final creative project due to advisor and second reader</span></li>
<li><span>April 22, 2019- Advisor and 2nd Reader Report due to Honors director</span></li>
<li><span>May 1, 2019 - Honors Director Report due to College Curriculum Council + student notified of honors status by Honors Director</span></li>
<li><span>May 26, 2019 - Student receives diploma indicating degree with honors!!!</span></li>
</ul>
<p class="p2"><span>Honors is awarded by the College Curriculum Council based on a recommendation by Honors director in Modern Culture and Media . Honors is not awarded by the College retroactively. Students who fail to complete their thesis by the Modern Culture and Media department deadline will not receive honors, even if they complete all requirements at a later time. If a thesis is turned in late but before the end of the term, credit and a grade for the thesis work may still be granted; however, the student will not receive honors.</span></p>
  </div>

	
  <div class="clear-block">
    <div class="meta">


	    
		</div><!-- end .meta -->
	</div>

</article>

          <h1><a href="http://www.brown.edu" accesskey="1" title="Brown University Homepage"><img src="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/sites/all/themes/pawtucket/img/brown-logo.png" alt="Brown University Seal" /><span>Brown University</span></a></h1>
            <section id="mobile-navigation">
  <div class="marginator">
  <nav id="mobile-nav" class="mmenu">     
		
        <div class="item-list">		
                             	<h3 class="current-site"><a href="">Modern Culture and Media</a></h3>

          <div class="banner-text">
				<h1><a href="/academics/modern-culture-and-media/" title=""><span class="site-title"></span></a></h1><div id="site-mission" class="mission banner-subtext"></div>			</div>
        </section>
